column1: good length, shaping away a little... looked to be inside the tramlines but signalled wide
short of a length outside off, Finch throws his hands up
fuller, around off stump and punched back to the bowler
angled in with the arm, Finch works this without timing to midwicket
short of a length on the hip, 82mph and Finch flicks it towards fine leg, where Rashid does a terrific job of cutting the ball off in front of the rope to prevent four
back of a length, this touches 88mph but Head calmly nudges his first delivery fine for one
short and rising over off stump, Finch defends stoutly
over the wicket, whirring in and looking for some away swing to Head, who defends
83mph, overpitched, that's a low full toss and Head greets it with a chunky whack through cover point for the first boundary
length ball, swinging a touch on off, pushed firmly to mid-on
slides this one down the leg side
bit of swing, length on the pads and worked wide of mid-on for a couple
drifts leg side again, that's helped firmly off the pads through backward square, beats Hales running around and runs for four
pitched up and drilled down the ground, Moeen gets a hand on it and mid-on but they'll pick up three
fired across, 87mph outside off and tapped into the covers
straighter line and Head works into the on side
fuller, 89mph and Head punches a drive, comes off the inside half of the bat to midwicket
strays on to he pads and that is neatly played, just a flick but it's timed well and races through square to the boundary
pushed across the bows at 88mph, tapped short of mid-off for one
superbly played off the pads, too straight from Ball and Finch just pings it wide of mid-on for his first boundary
angled in, no swing and flicked through square leg
nicely bowled, slides this across the right-hander from over the wicket, past the outside edge
now Finch gets on to the front foot and uses his muscle, bullied over extra cover for a no-nonsense four
heaved over the leg side, that's sailed into the crowd at deep square! Maybe a slower ball, 75mph and Finch was aiming more down the ground... but he still got plenty on it!
comes across and defends on off
pitched up and driven, Moeen misfields at mid-off but Finch still sends Head back, think he was probably home as the throw came in
round the wicket, sliding in and defended on off
chipped down the ground, shout of 'catch!' from Root but it lands well short of long-on, who has to tumble to prevent it skipping past for four
Root drags this down, width on offer and Head cashes the cheque with a meaty thwack through backward point
too straight, nudged off the pads towards short fine leg, they scamper the one
ho ho, they're not going to let Root settle today! Finch picks this up and spanks it straight back down the ground for four
floated up on off stump, bit of a miscue as Finch launches again, this plugs out towards deep extra cover for a couple
angled across, a touch full and stroked towards mid-off
in the channel, 87mph and Head comes forward to drive, sends it to extra cover
drilled past extra cover this time! Head is liking the pace in this pitch already, just steps out and belts his fifth four
on the legs and flicked for one

is that a drop? No, I don't think it quite carried... Finch glancing uppishly towards short fine leg, Curran dived forwards but couldn't quite get his hands underneath the ball. Prevented it getting away, though
slower ball, tucked off the pads for a single square
over the wicket, spinning in to hit the front pad as Finch reverse-sweeps... Buttler bellows an lbw appeal, but I think there was some glove on it
tossed up, gets a slight leading edge through mid-off for one

got him, Moeen strikes - snuck through into the timber! What a good series he's having, this just gripped and spun, cramping Finch as he swung across the line, clipped the bottom edge and then rattled the stumps
flat on off stump, Stoinis shows it a straight bat

oh, what's he done...? Stoinis falls second ball, swept without timing straight to short fine leg! Good running catch from Ball, England have another. You could see what Stoinis was trying to do, but it was poorly executed, having barely had a sighter; two in three balls for Moeen
flatter, on the pads but works to short fine leg
short of a length and nudged for one
overptiched, in the slot outside off, Head throws the hands through a rasping square drive and beats the dive of point for four
full again, this time Head skims his drive to cover
back of a length, 83mph and flicked to short fine leg on the bounce
slower ball, the offcutter from ball and Head spoons a leading edge up and over the bowler! Lands safely between mid-off and mid-on for a single, too
stays back in the crease and defends
pushed through and defended on off
Head charges down this time, gets to the pitch and whumps a straight drive down the ground to long-off
flat delivery, Head comes out again and dabs into a gap
sliding on to the pads, Marsh gets off the mark with a nurdle to backward square
floated up and pushed away defensively on the front foot
angled in and Head is happy to pat the single down the ground
slightly short and wide, Head whips his hands quickly through a late cut, gets it away for another boundary behind point
tighter line, goes back and across to defend
short on the body and Head nudges a single square
back of a length once again and Marsh works it to midwicket where Ball has to give chase

short, angled across outside off, Head rocks back and ramps one down to third man... That's his half-century, third of the series for Head. Another rapid effort, too, from 36 balls. Can he go on today?
dug in and Marsh prods back defensively on the leg side
on the stumps, Head drills it back to the bowler
pushed through on the stumps and worked against the spin
angled in and Marsh clips one more to leg
flat delivery outside off, Head drops back and cuts one to the cover sweeper
tossed up and punched to extra cover on the front foot
flighted, Marsh gets forward on off stump and strokes one down the ground to long-off
round the wicket, short of a length and nudged to leg for a couple
goes over the wicket now, cross-seam delivery and it skids on as Marsh defends into the ground in front of the stumps, they steal the one
angled across, Head steers towards point
short, 81mph but too leg side and Head only needs to get a scrape of bat to send it fine off the pads for four

on the body, Head is tucked up and loops the ball straight to midwicket! He looks at his bat in frustration, Head falls after making an attractive fifty once again... Plunkett's modus operandi pays off, maybe bounced a bit more than expected and it was a simple catch for Morgan
full, quite wide of the stumps, Carey lets it go
sliding in with the arm, Marsh works it down to long-on
floated up full on middle and off, Carey presses forward to block
nicely done, Carey gets front on and reverse-sweeps hard past backward point for four - nice way to get off the mark
pushed through and tapped into the covers
tossed up and turning a touch, but that's wide of the tramlines
straighter, flicked into the leg side

Marsh reaches forward, overbalances and Buttler whips off the bails - is that a stumping...? Yes, superb bit of work from the keeper, Marsh's foot clearly dangling in the air as his weight went too far forwards; Moeen has a third, spinning it past the outside edge, and Australia in real trouble!
back of a length, pushed across from over the wicket and left alone
shortish, Carey tries to open the face and run a single, clips the inside edge and ricochets into the body but falls safely
length, 81mph and this pops up, likely another cross-seamer and Carey pops a drive through cover point
speared down the leg side
dabbed down into the off side and they hurry through for a single to get Paine off the mark
on the stumps, Carey gets into line
length ball, closes the face and turns to midwicket

brilliant from Buttler! Dropped into the leg side, this is another tight single... and Buttler has raced after it and superbly thrown down the stumps at the bowler's end! Paine has run himself out, but it took some brilliant work from his rival stumper: scampering to his left, picking up and turning to throw unsighted, the ball just flicking off the bails - stupendous stuff!
pushed through and steered square on the off side
comes forward and taps back defensively
tossed up and flicked back down the ground
shouts of interest as Carey gets an inside edge on to his pads
floated up full and worked for a single into the on side
bit of width, Carey opens the face and runs a single to third man
comes across and pushes towards cover point from the crease
back of a length, but down the leg side
length ball around fourth stump, Short comes forward and strokes his first run through cover
round the wicket, touch short and Carey glides another single to third man
over the wicket, on a good length, 82mph and punched to extra cover
shorter, Short stays back and dabs the ball towards point
floated up full and Carey takes on the slog-sweep, cleanly struck over midwicket and it bounces away for four - nicely done
angled in flatter and this is nudged with good placement into a gap on the leg side

quick delivery outside off, Carey goes across early and telegraphs his intention to ramp the ball, Buttler moves outside leg... but the flick beats him to his left, just a thick edge really but it runs away to fine leg for another boundary
tossed up straight and turned square for a single
flat offbreak on off stump, blocked from the crease
tossed up full, Short stuns a drive down the ground to long-off
back of a length at middle and off, defended to backward point
touch shorter, straight, played into backward point
full at off stump, driven firmly to short cover
good stuff from Plunkett, no width on offer, back of a length and pushed to cover
ah, having said how good it was, this one is offered up full and with some width, Short throws his hands through a handsome drive
comes round the wicket, he chases a delivery with some width, gets a bottom edge which isn't a million miles from the stumps
plays back and pushes to the bowler
places it through the off side from the back foot, out to deep cover
back of a length, driven to cover
full at middle and leg, defended to the on side
comes forward and this takes a thick inside edge to the leg side
full at the stumps, driven firmly just to the right of Moeen who can't quite get down to it
over the wicket, driven to cover
gets down and sweeps this from leg stump to deep square
full and straight, nudged back down the pitch
touch shorter, he goes onto the back foot and pushes into the covers
good length, waits this to turn a touch, plays to the on side
very full at off stump, a wristy flick finds midwicket
round the wicket, a firm sweep picks out Rashid at short fine leg
slower through the air, pushed down to long-on
short of a length, tucked through midwicket
driven past cover down to long-off
plays this very late, cuts it off the stumps to short third man
this grips! Short gets squared up as he plays back, the leading edge runs into the point area
full outside leg, swept behind square
full at the stumps, driven to mid-off
shovels a shorter delivery out to deep square leg
works this from off stump into midwicket
full, driven in the air, just wide of cover and mid-off gets across
back and across, it's a length ball outside off, played back to the bowler
almost another run out! He pressed forward, worked a full delivery through midwicket, Carey turned for the second but it wasn't on and he needed to get the dive out
full and straight, flicked to long-on
gets down and across to off stump, sweeps firmly to deep square leg
touch shorter on off stump, pushed to deep cover
that's a strong shot down the ground...Root gets too full, Carey pumps it straight back over his head
some width outside off this time and it's beautifully driven through the covers, wide of the sweeper
full at middle and leg, this is very nicely timed through midwicket with a strong flick, Hales just manages to stop the boundary. Fifty stand
full at off stump, defended
very full, pushed through the covers with an open face and good placement allows the second
full and straight, flicked back to the bowler
full outside leg stump, poor delivery, Carey puts it away with a sweep wide of short fine leg
that's a big full toss but only costs as a single as it's swept to deep square
strikes first ball! Back of a length outside off, Carey has a nibble and it's a thin edge to Buttler. Just trying to steer it to third man. A maiden ODI wicket for Sam Curran
full and straight, defended to the leg side

oh my goodness! He's left a straight one It goes from bad to worse for Australia. He's shoulder arms to a delivery that has hit middle and off. Unbelievable. He must have thought it was going to swing away. It certainly didn't. Would even have been too close to leave if he had moved! Jeepers
back of a length outside off, defended with an open face to backward point
that's a little lazy by midwicket, Richardson gets inside the line of a back-of-a-length delivery and flicks to the leg side. Should have been stopped
a bouncer, sails over Richardson's head, called a wide
touch of extra bounce, short of a length at off stump, it's well played as he takes his bottom hand off the bat and runs it to third man

just out of reach! Plunkett got finger tips to it. Richardson went after a flighted leg-break, aiming down the ground, the turn means it gets a thick outside edge which loops high towards mid-off. Plunkett can't quite make the ground
pushed to mid-on
plays back to quite a full delivery and defends
goes back and pushes into the covers
very full, at the stumps, jabbed to the off side
goes back again and plays all over the top of a delivery that slides on outside off
spears in a leg-stump yorker, deflects off the pad behind square...actually, there's some bat involved
good length outside off, defended to backward point
out with a hit! Australia all over the shop. Was a shorter delivery, defended into backward point, they went through the run and Roy couldn't hit direct
gets this one away, short outside off, back cuts it between point and short third man
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler, Curran sticks out his right hand
length ball at off stump, worked to long-on
full outside leg stump, swept to deep square leg
lofts a full, straight delivery over midwicket
gets forward to a leg-break, defends
plays back to another legspinner, pushed to the off side
that's a hefty thump! Picks up a full delivery from outside off and swings it over the long-on boundary

another run out? Yes, he's gone! The ball deflected off the pad to short fine leg, there was all sorts of confusion over the ball. Richardson eventually turned to get back. Brings out the dive but it's not enough. His bat is on the line (and in the air). An excellent take by Buttler, in front of the stumps, on the half volley
good length, angled into the pads, worked into midwicket
full at the stumps, the bat twists in his hands as he works it through the leg side but he's able to get back to retain the strike
gets a yorker in, straight, dug out down the ground
back of a length at middle and leg, defended to the on side
nicely bowled, fuller and outside off, slides past the bat although Lyon may have pulled the bat inside the line
this one beats him for sure, attempts a drive at a fuller delivery and it scoots past the edge
short of a length, he plays back and angles it to point
worked off the stumps, straight of midwicket and down the ground
he sweeps from outside off to deep square leg
tucked off the pads to deep midwicket
attempts another sweep, the delivery is out as full, he misses and gets taken on the body

there's an appeal for lbw and then the catch...Root takes it at slip. Given not out for both and England review. The lbw looks outside the line. Was there an edge? There is a spike on Snicko. But was it bat hitting ground? Third umpire reckons so. I'm not so sure, but evidence has to be conclusive. The lbw was also well outside off, so England lose their review
appeal for a catch down the leg side, given not out and England have used up their review
good shot, drives on the up through the line and sends this racing wide of mid-off
picks this up off his pads, it's in the air for a while but falls short of deep square as Bairstow runs in
round the wicket, beats the outside edge with a short-of-a-length delivery which angles in
beats him again! Goes wide on the crease from round the wicket, angled in full outside, Lyon goes for the drive
back over the wicket, slides another past Lyon's bat as this goes across him on the angle. Very nice bowling
full and straight, driven to mid-off on the edge of the circle
nudged off the pads into midwicket

and he's done him! Skids through slowly, Lyon goes back to play the pull, doesn't make contact and that's right in front although Lyon, at the last moment, calls the review. Don't think so, Nathan. His back leg is bent right in front of the stumps. Smashing leg stump.
full outside leg, prods forward with bat and pad
full outside off, he stretches forward and defends to backward point
full at the pads, tucked to the leg side. Purely survival for Stanlake
round the wicket, angled into the stumps, he rocks back and places this nicely square through the off side
down the pitch, makes it into a low full toss, bunted down the ground and he's frustrated it's only the single
goes back to a shortish delivery and plays to mid-on
driven into the off side
dragged down short, driven straight down the ground but mid-on is able to get across
can't get the strike back, fired in quickly by Moeen and Short bunts it back to the bowler
on the stumps, flicked to the leg side
full outside off, driven into the covers, parried away by Morgan and it allows Stanlake off strike
goes for the sweep, doesn't make contact, bobbles around Buttler's gloves and is given a wide
connects nicely with the sweep but goes one bounce to the man at deep square
that beats him, a googly slides past the outside edge as he plays back
beaten again, lunging forward at a googly
a muted appeal for a bat-pad catch as this loops up and Buttler hops around to collection
super shot...skips down the pitch and lofts this straight down the ground
shorter, flatter, he rocks back and drives to deep cover
full and straight, defended

and that's all over! Stanlake plays back outside leg stump, a shortish delivery slides on with the angle from round the wicket. He's not in the same postcode and it clatters leg stump. Career-best for Moeen Ali
angled in straight and Roy skips out, works the ball to mid-on
tossed up, Roy punches this uppishly, wide of the diving Agar and he's off the mark with one to long-off
full, quick and dipping on middle and leg, YJB makes room and punches a drive past extra cover

bowled him, straight through Roy! The tactical ploy works, Agar strikes in the first over, Roy aiming a yahoo down the ground but playing around the ball, bowled off his pad. Left-arm spin does the trick, misjudged the flight and that wasn't a great shot
drifting on to the pads but Hales can't get it past short fine leg
tossed up straight and tapped back
length, 86mph over off stump and Bairstow defends
good pace and carry outside off, lets this one go
length ball, 87mph and pushed into the covers coming across
gets a touch straighter and YJB flicks the ball away through backward square leg
tight lines, Hales shows it a straight bat on off stump
full on middle and leg, Hales clips defensively towards mid-on from the crease
angled in with the arm and worked to midwicket
full on off stump, pushed back down the track
flighted, off-stump line and YJB wanders down to poke one through mid-off
touch full, Hales just waits on this and strokes a well-timed on drive away for the first boundary wide of the man on the ring
tossed up on off, pushed into the covers
Hales comes across and blocks back to the bowler
short outside off, climbing through to Paine as Bairstow swings hard and misses
dug in, YJB fences off the back foot, thick outside edge but it flies wide of slip... and Short then messes up his fielding effort at third man to gift four!
comes across, rides the bounce into the covers
back of a length, 91mph and slashed through backward point, they come back for two
good heat, 91mph again as Bairstow comes across and blocks into the off side
tip and run, dropped down in front of cover and Head can't hit at the non-striker's end as YJB runs his bat in
flighted, worked off leg stump and Agar runs across to field
full on off, YJB taps it into the off side
angled in and defended on the stumps
Bairstow is shifting around in his crease skittishly, can't get the ball away again
flicked off the pads, into a gap at backward square leg and they comes hustling back for two
pushed down the leg side, Bairstow sweeps and misses... Paine can't grab it, didn't come off anything, so that's two wides to the total
floated up on off, Hales pats it back

oh, that's out - chopped into this stumps! Stanlake strikes, bringing the ball in as Bairstow went back to cut, too cramped for the shot and he could only bottom-edge into his timbers. Another reminder that England have a bit of work to do if they're going to get a 5-0 of their own
cranks up the pace, this is 93mph but defended nonchalantly into the covers coming across
short and rising towards the ribs, Root gets a bit of bat/glove on it and picks up one behind square on the leg side
length ball 87mph on off, comes across to defend
threaded through point, nicely timed by Hales and it gives Head a real chase out towards the boundary... he does brilliantly to pull the ball in just in front of the rope

climbing, 88mph outside off, Root fends and sends a thick edge to slip! Two in the over for Stanlake and England are having a proper wobble now... Root chastises himself in frustration, it was short enough that he didn't have to play, but the heat drew him in - and then singed Marsh's hands as he clung on in front of his face!
pushed through outside off and tapped square
flighted, Hales steps out and pings a cover drive, gets it between two fielders and that will run away
Hales moves on to off stump and works to midwicket with the spin
tossed up, comes across to block
gets across on off and defends
flighted, this is clipped firmly to the right of mid-on but there's no run there
back of a length, 89mph on middle and leg stump, Morgan calmly taps it down
bangs in the bumper, Morgan ducks
back of a length, 85mph around off stump, defended to cover

ANOTHER! Stanlake shatters the stumps, England four down! Just too quick for him, on a length and Morgan seemed to play around it, the ball rattles middle and off... and Australia must believe they can do this now!
length, 93mph again, Stanlake burning brightly on this famous old ground, Buttler defends
back of a length in the channel, whizzing through at 88mph as Buttler leaves it be
flighted, drifting to leg, turned off his pads
tossed up on off stump, Hales strokes a single through mid-off
this grips a little and hits the outside edge as Buttler prods at it
angled in a bit straighter, pushed back to the bowler
goes back and cracks a drive into the covers, well stopped on the dive
flighted, Buttler punches square but picks out the fielder again
short of a length outside off, guided through backward point from the crease
beats the bat again! Rising sharply at 92mph in the channel as Buttler tries to punch off the back foot
full and driven, squirted down to third man for a single
full outside off, 88mph and Hales strokes it towards mid-off coming across
full, 90mph and tailing in a touch, punched towards extra cover
short and wide to finish the Powerplay, Hales rocks back and belts it through point for four
slides on with the arm, Buttler drives and gets a thick inside edge, past leg stump and Paine hasn't a chance, runs away for four!
tossed up on off, Buttler gets out to the pitch and pushes through mid-off
gives this some air, Hales defends on off stump
quicker, 59mph as Hales goes back and defends
flighted, drifting leg side, turned for one off the inside edge
floated up wide of off stump and Buttler pushes a drive square for one more
length outside off and Buttler is able to get forward, driven through cover for a couple
already he is walking at the bowler, Richardson a mid-80s mph man... tucked to mid-on
length, 82mph on off, chopped down
wide line as Buttler walks across, 84mph and steered to backward point
length on off stump, tapped towards mid-off
stand and deliver, clubbed down the ground and he gets it over the head of mid-off! Took a risk, but it paid off
tossed up nice and slow, Hales drives one down the ground
tossed up wide of the stumps, guided towards backward point from the crease
comes across and pinches a single
flighted, Hales defends on the front foot
slows his pace, full on leg stump, nurdled for one - that's the England 50 (a mark Australia reached in just the fifth over earlier today)
flat on off, Buttler prods it into the covers

gottim, Hales nicks a wide one to the keeper! England are five down now, certainly doing a very gentlemanly job of letting Australia back into the game... Richardson is the beneficiary, an innocuous ball in the channel, but Hales flapped without foot movement and got a thin edge
angled across from over the wicket, 83mph outside off, Moeen leaves
back of a length, defended down in front of point
short, 82mph and leg side, Moeen plays across the line... and gets a leading edge that flies down to third man for his first run
pitched up, touch of seam movement as Buttler reaches out and get a low edge behind square
short on the body, 83mph and tucked down square for a single
round the wicket, tossed up and defended to leg
flatter on the stumps, Moeen covers the line
worked into the leg side, Head swoops and a direct hit would leave Moeen stranded... but he misses! Terrible bit of running, but he gets away with it
over the wicket, tossed up full and dabbed into a gap square
Moeen presses forward on off stump
flighted, around the line of off, solidly defended coming forwards
Buttler takes a couple of steps down early, blocked behind point but Lyon is quickly in
fullish, 82mph and whipped off the stumps through midwicket
full, gets him driving, Buttler hits this in the air - but past the dive of Head at extra cover, races away for four!
comes across and taps the ball down
Paine up to the stumps again, but this is short and wide and Buttler slams a ferocious cut in front of backward point for another boundary

length on the stumps, slower ball and Buttler swats it in the air down towards fine leg, bounces in front of the man and they trot the single - and that will be lunch, with 15 wickets having fallen so far at Old Trafford
round the wicket, pushed across outside off, dabbed to short third man
gets forward and pushes to the off side
uses his feet, clips it firmly back to Lyon's right and he can't stop it cleanly
drift in from round the wicket, takes a thick inside edge to the leg side
pushed square into the off side
goes back and across, defended
short of a length at leg stump, into the ribs, knocked into midwicket
short of a length outside off, chopped to point
nips back from just short of a length, defended from the crease
touch fuller, angled in at off stump, 86mph, defended
gets right across outside off and walks at the delivery, defended to the off side
tries to angle a back-of-a-length delivery to third man but he's cramped for room and finds point
that's a beauty! Turn and bounce. Angled in to off stump, spins away to beat the edge. Memories of the Ashes
full at the stumps, pushed into the covers for a scampered single
round the wicket, full at off stump, driven to mid-off
back and across, deep in the crease, knocks a length delivery into square leg
full at off stump, Moeen comes forward and drives to deep cover
pushed into the off side
back of a length at middle and off, defended to mid-on
on the pads, hops inside the line and pushes to deep square
almost steps into his stumps! Short at the body, he swivels his pull, and just has to watch where his feet are. Not that close in the end, really
good length at off stump, 88mph, punched to cover
very full outside off, driven to the cover sweeper
short outside off, Buttler walks right across his crease, plays at the top of the bounce and angles it to third man
stays round the wicket, comes down the pitch but can't quite get to the ball so defends
worked off the pads to short fine leg
goes for the reverse sweep and it loops behind him, past Paine, to short fine leg. Not sure if glove involved
cuts a shorter delivery to deep point
flicked to the left of mid-on
full at the stumps, defended on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, defended towards point
edged! No slips in place...a forcing shot off the back foot, goes fine of third man but Stanlake is able to get across
that's a wild slash outside off, although it was a pretty short delivery
full and straight, defended to cover
defends a good length delivery to the off side
short of a length outside off, enough width that he can drive through the line to deep cover
round the wicket, full at straight, defended on the front foot
nice loop, draws Moeen forward and he pushes into the point area
gets away with this! Goes for the sweep and it's a big top edge, carries a long way in the air but the man is a long way behind square leg
full and straight, driven to long-off
gets forward and whips his hands through a drive which finds mid-off
brings out the reverse sweep, the ball is quite wide outside off but he gets well across the crease, keeps it down through backward point
taken at backward point! Back of a length, Moeen gets squared up, takes a thick outside edge and there's a simple catch for Lyon
short of a length at off stump, he's behind the line and defends
plays this quite late and it goes down into the pitch then bobbles back towards the keeper
opens the face and angles this down to third man
shuffles across the stumps and works a straight delivery to deep square
short of a length, defended towards mid-off
uses the crease well then opens the face and places this through backward point, makes it back for the second despite slipping as he turned
worked off the pads into square leg
a ripper! Plenty in this surface for the spinners. This turns sharply to beat the outside edge
worked off the pads to square leg, excellent fielding by Marsh almost creates a run out but Curran gets back
gets forward and drives to deep cover
goes back deep in the crease and tucks this towards square leg
short, Buttler walks at the bowler, pulled round the corner to long leg
back of a length at off stump, he plays a forcing shot off the back foot and it goes behind point to third man
another short ball, gets over the top of the bounce and pulls again to long leg
short of a length, punched off the back foot to mid-off
another one played off the back foot to the off side
a short ball, he drops his hands and lets it go through to Paine
full outside off, pushed to cover
straighter, worked off the pads to midwicket
opens the face and dabs a length delivery into backward point

big appeal for lbw, given not out by Rob Bailey. They debate the review and go for it! Round the wicket, angled into middle and leg. Did it straighten enough? Certainly no bat involved. Umpire's call on clipping leg stump. Australia keep their review
wider outside off, left alone
good length at off stump, solid stride forward and he defends
short of a length at off stump, worked to the leg side
shovels a short ball from outside off to deep square leg
full outside off, opens the face and taps it through point
short of a length, punched to short cover
tries to use soft hands to angle this to third man but finds backward point
finds the gap this time, drives it square wide of point and the sweeper can't stop the second
starts with a big drag down which Curran latches onto and swings it over long-on with a pull shot...think he was aiming a little squarer. Mighty blow
left alone outside off
nicely bowled, good length at off stump, tapped to the covers...Buttler has to stretch to make sure he gets in
plays back and works into the square-leg area
driven into the covers
short again, Curran rocks and pulls strongly over midwicket. Expensive over from Short
has he edged this?! No, not quite...a wide one from Richardson, Buttler reaches for it as he tries to drive
full and wide, this time he finds the middle as he drives to deep cover

there's an edge on this one...isn't there?! Curran plays a flashing drive. There's a noise. Given not out. Review called straightaway. Big spike on Snicko. Kumar has to reverse his decision. Good job for Australia that previous one was umpire's call

super catch! Plunkett goes first ball. That's a horrid shot. He has Buttler at the other end, but chases a full, wide delivery with no footwork. This one's a thick edge, and Paine does very well to grab it low to his right.
fullish and tailing in, Rashid lines it up and blocks doggedly
pitched up in the channel, 82mph and he lets this one go
length outside off, Buttler steers it square from the crease
fullish, 84mph and Buttler pushes away from his body, zips through past the edge
dug in short, Buttler swipes a pull through square leg, almost off his feet to play the shot but it's only worth one
banged in halfway down, hits the splice as Rashid takes his bottom hand off
84mph in the channel, comes across and leaves
short, 86mph and defended on off as Rashid hops into line
short on the hips and Buttler nudges it away for a couple... the crowd applauds what they think is his fifty, but the umpire then plays spoilsport by signalling leg byes
lets this one go outside off
full, 83mph and driven towards mid-off
comes down as Richardson pushes the ball out wide, left alone
seams away a touch, Buttler reaches and gets a thick edge, runs wide of Paine... that will be four, and a half-century for Buttler, who is England's one hope of pulling victory out of the fire here
tapped into the covers, thinks better of trying to pinch one
length on middle and off, Rashid gets squared up but blocks solidly
pitched up and driven with a wristy flourish through backward point, a couple to the left of the sweeper
defended down into the off side
tight lines, 82mph and dabbed behind point, Buttler sends him back
pitched up, Rashid comes across and mistimes a drive into the covers
wicket-to-wicket from Stoinis, again Rashid shows it a watchful straight bat
length outside off, Buttler is forward to dab one short into the covers
whippage from Rashid, comes across and bottom-hands a flick over backward square... not where anyone was expecting that ball to go
full on the stumps, Buttler just gets a touch on it to skim the ball fine - and Stanlake's dive on the boundary rope is in vain!
comes across and pushes into the covers
pitched up outside off, driven firmly in front of deep cover and they scamper back for two
pitched up, 83mph as Buttler comes down and jams another single through cover to keep the strike
slower-ball bouncer from Stoinis, but this has gone wrong, looping high and wide on the off side
good length outside off, 83mph and Buttler cushions it in front of cover-point for a single
length over the top of off, defended
pushed down the leg side, flick and a miss... but that's a wide
pitched on a length outside off, dabs one to third man
tighter line, Buttler defends to cover
Buttler comes across on off and drives one to long-on
fired in straight, Rashid showcases his solid defensive technique
short outside off, Buttler stabs a back-foot drive to the cover boundary
in the channel, neatly played by Rashid, running the ball with an angled bat to third man... Stoinis sprawls to cut it off but they come back for two
looks like a change-up, 79mph from Stanlake and Rashid is through the shot early and takes it on the body
half-tracker and that is dispatched! Buttler rocks back and hammers four through midwicket
length in the channel, 84mph and tapped towards point
back of a length outside off, just 82mph and Buttler defends
round the wicket, tossed up on off and wristed towards mid-on
pushed through, Rashid plays a cute little dab (or cushioned outside edge) fine of third man for a couple
tossed up and turned into the leg side for one
rolls his arm over on middle and leg, Buttler nudges a single into a gap at square leg
on the stumps, Rashid plays with the spin and picks up another easy single square - the Old Trafford crowd applauds England's 150
flighted, around off stump, Buttler defends softly
back of a length, 88mph outside off, Rashid jumps into line and blocks
shortish, 88mph, Rashid drops into the crease and angles one to third man
pitched up, going for the leg-stump yorker but it drifts further and flicks the pad before leaving Paine on his knees - four more to the total!

turned into the leg side, Buttler hares off and wants a second... this going to be close! Buttler seemed to stumble as he came back, the throw was hard and flat and Paine demolished the stumps - but the third umpire confirms he was home by half a yard!
pitched up outside off, punched hard to extra cover
full, Buttler laces a drive through the covers, just a single... and that is Stanlake done for the day
tossed up on middle and leg, worked through square on the back foot
flighted, worked back through mid-on for one
pushed through and Buttler goes back to chop one uppishly through cover point
over the wicket now, flat and spinning in a touch, Rashid defends
lobbed up outside off, met with a front-foot block
quicker, using overspin, the ball skids on but Rashid brings his bat down to block
good length, defended coming across
in the channel outside off, 80mph and Buttler taps it down
Richardson is getting a hint of reverse... but that has taken this down the leg side for a wide
good length, 85mph over the stumps, Buttler blocks down into the on side
full, Buttler is forward, transferring the weight beautifully through a straight drive that beats mid-off and rattles to the fence
angled in, 81mph and tapped towards mid-on
tapped down into the covers, they hustle the one
fired in on off stump, grips a touch and Buttler thick-edges a back-foot drive wide of Paine... it runs all the way fine for four!
flighted, angling in and nudged to leg
tossed up and dabbed into the off side, they think better of running
floated up and Buttler drills an uppish blow back past Agar, no real chance to get down to his right, just a single to long-on
pushed through flat and quick, Rashid does well to get his bat down
flighted, nice and slow, Rashid leans into a push to long-off, ticking them through
pitched full, Rashid tamps down on it, runs to cover
length ball outside off, blocked square
full in the channel, Rashid wafts a thick-edged drive wide of third man for a few more, to boozy cheers from the crowd
oh my, that's timed like a beauty! Just a push-drive from Buttler as he walks down, but he sends it skimming in front of the cover sweeper for four!
full, 82mph and steered through the covers
length on off, Rashid blocks stoutly once more
flighted on middle and leg, worked through wide long-on
pushed through in the channel, Rashid punches one
dragged down, Buttler drops back and crunches a drive in front of the sweeper, Carey doing terrifically well to cut it off and prevent four
tossed up and driven to extra cover
flatter, stays low, punched through the covers
fired into the pitch, Rashid stuns a square drive for one more... Run-scoring hasn't looked this straightforward all day
pitched up in the channel, Rashid clips a drive casually through cover
length ball, 78mph and tight to off stump, driven to mid-off
Buttler is down the pitch, whipped through midwicket, superbly struck and that's four more!
Paine up to the stumps, full and tailing in, driven firmly, a misfield gives them a single
hits the pitch hard, 81mph on a length over off stump, Rashid blocks calmly
takes the pace off, 72mph and it sits up for Rashid to nurdle one more through square leg
lobbed up and tapped to the leg side
pushed through outside off, guided towards backward point
flighted, this spins a touch, hits the inside edge as Rashid props forward
tight lines, pushed through on the stumps, Rashid defends again
angled in straight, again Rashid plunges on to the front foot and smothers it
Rashid defends once more - sees out a maiden!
wicket-to-wicket with the keeper up, Buttler blocks to leg
pitched up and driven through the covers on the front foot
on the stumps, Rashid shows it a straight bat
tight lines and defended again

oh, my word, where's this going...? Stanlake takes the catch running in at fine leg! Australia have separated the ninth-wicket pair, with 11 runs still needed! Whipped across the line, again the bottom hand took over but he got a leading/top edge that somehow went swirling over his shoulder, Stanlake had to compose himself but took it well plunging forwards!
smashed down the ground, that's a huuuuuuuuuuuge six! Buttler slams a mighty blow back over everyone's head to go to his century! England need 5, but Ball will have to face the next over!
pushed through quickly outside off, play and a miss from Ball!
lobbed up on leg stump, hits the pad as he prods at the ball
full on off, Ball jams his bat down and squirts it to cover
flat and skipping on with the arm, defended on off stump
angled in, Ball watches this closely and nudges it off his pad... he almost goes for the run before realising he just has to keep one more delivery out!
defended back on off stump! Ball sees out a maiden - now it's over to Buttler
pitched up and driven, he's looking for two wide of long-off... but it's struck too firmly, they'll only get one!
pitched up, tailing in a touch, Ball blocks it
full, 82mph and aiming for the blockhole, Ball bunts it firmly to extra cover!
good length, wide of the stumps, Ball reaches for it and taps to point
full, angling in and Ball flicks it off his pads, wide of fine leg... and they take the single! Buttler back on strike, but he's only got one delivery left in the over
low full toss, Buttler whacks it through mid-off for an easy single with the man back
shortish, 78mph on the hip and Buttler clips it to the sweeper... but this time refuses the one
back of a length outside off, Paine is up and Buttler defends

driven on the up, he gets it through the ring at cover - and England win by one wicket to claim a 5-0 whitewash! A fabulous innings from Buttler, he finishes 110 not out, and finishes Australia's hopes of a consolation win at the last
